Studies have shown that the radiofrequency radiation from cell towers can damage DNA and lead to the development of tumors. In fact, the World Health Organization has classified radiofrequency electromagnetic fields as possibly carcinogenic to humans.

In addition to cancer risks, 5G exposure has been linked to a variety of other health problems. Some researchers have also suggested that 5G radiation may exacerbate symptoms of electromagnetic hypersensitivity, a condition characterized by sensitivity to electromagnetic fields.

Furthermore, the rollout of 5G networks involves the installation of many more cell towers closer to homes and schools, meaning that people will be exposed to higher levels of radiation for longer periods of time. This increased exposure is particularly concerning for vulnerable populations like children and pregnant women.

While more research is needed to fully understand the long-term health impacts of 5G, the existing evidence should give us pause. It is crucial that we proceed with caution and prioritize public health over corporate profits. We must demand that our governments and the telecommunications industry take these risks seriously and implement measures to protect the public from the potential dangers of 5G technology.
